SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person submitting this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. If, however, there is something you feel should be included in the questionnaire, please let us know.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experiences or the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Diet: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being compiled. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

All questionnaires

Pioneer health conditions

Pioneer social life

Sports and recreation

Pioneer housing

Pioneer education and churchwork

Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent records of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Canada

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who has lived in Western Canada for more than a few years will have had exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. The questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of this pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or reply on a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: What Did You Answer This?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you are willing to answer.

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
- Pioneer housing
- Pioneer education and churchwork
- Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires:

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent records of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Canada.

To you my dearest son,

I am writing this letter to express my deepest gratitude and love for you. You have been an incredible source of strength and support throughout our lives. Your kindness, compassion, and dedication have touched countless lives.

As we reflect on the past year, I am reminded of all the wonderful memories we have shared together. From our adventures in nature to the joyous moments at home, every experience has been a blessing.

I want you to know how much you mean to me. Your presence brings light into my life, and I am grateful for every moment we spend together.

With all my love,

[Signature]

P.S. Remember to always be kind and compassionate. Your actions can inspire others to do the same.
